reviews.text: This is an interesting City station, that has very long platforms underground. It has exits at both ends which take you to completely different parts of that area. I like the newish train stock this line now has.

I really like the look at this station, definitely still has the look and feel of Network Southeast in places which is quite nice. The station has two exits with escalators and lifts to give step free access to the platforms here however the lifts are very small with an incredibly restricted capacity. Other than that, the station is in a good location.

A great stop off point if you want St Pauls Cathedral, exit at Ludgate Hill for a short walk up to the Cathedral. There is a Costa within the station area upstairs and this is a helpful station. It tends to close earlier than other station but blackfriars is very close for when this happens

The first time I got off a train here, I said, 'I'm the first person in my family to get off a train at City Thameslink!' I was so happy I called my brother, who told me he'd got off a train there about two years ago. I was devastated, especially since I'd already bought a fancy cup and had it engraved. When it comes back from the engravers, I'm going to smash it against a wall!
It's getting on a bit but still ok... and has toilets
